name: Congenital Chylothorax with Refractory Hydrops
chief_complaint: Severe respiratory distress and swelling noted at birth

lab_results.lymphocyte count: >80% of white cells in pleural fluid

prognosis: Guarded (50% mortality if bilateral; higher with hydrops)
description: A rare condition where lymphatic fluid accumulates in the pleural space due to maldevelopment or trauma to the thoracic duct, often causing life-threatening respiratory compromise and hydrops fetalis. Most severe cases present in utero or immediately after birth.
